data.title: Build Error - Loading index.js tasks / Module did not self register
data.body:
Hi,

I'm trying to build Atom, following the [instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/windows.md), but while running `script/build` it fail with the following error:

```
Node: v1.3.0
npm: v2.5.1
Python: v2.7.9
Installing build modules...
Installing apm...
Installing modules done
Deduping modules done
Loading "index.js" tasks...ERROR
>> Error: Module did not self-register.
Running "download-atom-shell" task
Running "download-atom-shell-chromedriver" task
Running "build" task
Running "coffee:glob_to_multiple" (coffee) task
>> 336 files created.
Running "prebuild-less:src" (prebuild-less) task
Running "cson:glob_to_multiple" (cson) task
>> 170 files compiled to JSON.
Running "peg:glob_to_multiple" (peg) task
Running "generate-license:save" (generate-license) task
Running "generate-module-cache" task
Running "compile-packages-slug" task
Running "set-exe-icon" task
Running "set-version" task
Running "generate-asar" task
Running "install" task
Aborted due to warnings.
```

The `verbose` says:

```
[1mRegistering "grunt-atom-shell-installer" local Npm module tasks.[22m
Reading C:\AtomBuilded\1.0.0\atom\build\node_modules\grunt-atom-shell-installer\package.json...[32mOK[39m
Parsing C:\AtomBuilded\1.0.0\atom\build\node_modules\grunt-atom-shell-installer\package.json...[32mOK[39m
Loading "index.js" tasks...[31mERROR[39m
[31m>> [39mError: Module did not self-register.[31m
>> [39m  at Error (native)[31m
>> [39m  at Module.load (module.js:339:32)[31m
>> [39m  at Function.Module._load (module.js:294:12)[31m
>> [39m  at Module.require (module.js:349:17)[31m
>> [39m  at require (module.js:368:17)[31m
>> [39m  at bindings (C:\AtomBuilded\1.0.0\atom\build\node_modules\grunt-atom-shell-installer\node_modules\asar\node_modules\chromium-pickle\node_modules\bindings\bindings.js:76:44)[31m
>> [39m  at Object.<anonymous> (C:\AtomBuilded\1.0.0\atom\build\node_modules\grunt-atom-shell-installer\node_modules\asar\node_modules\chromium-pickle\lib\main.js:1:99)[31m
>> [39m  at Module._compile (module.js:444:26)[31m

>> [39m  at Module._compile (module.js:444:26)[31m

```

Settings:
- Windows 10 Insider
- io.js version 1.3.0
- Python 2.7.0

Thanks in advance

data.title: Move browser process requires earlier
data.body:
This is a stopgap solution to intermittent require errors in the browser process because of an asar/electron bug. This will not be needed once #6877 is merged.

Follow on to https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/7560

Closes #6276
Closes #7591 
Closes https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/192
Closes https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/399

data.title: tabs@0.82.0
data.body: This includes a fix for https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/182

data.title: Uncaught exception round up
data.body:
I took a look at the reported [uncaught exceptions](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+is%3Apublic+label%3Auncaught-exception) and broke them down into a couple categories.
# Add Guards

_These are ones that looked like they weren't guarding adequately for different inputs that could happen. These appear to the easiest to fix at first glance._
## Core
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4957
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5468
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5593
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6587
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7282
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7714
## Packages
- [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/issues/353
- [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/issues/475
- [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/issues/480 (affecting 555 people)
- [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/issues/488
- [x] https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/402
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/86
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/110
- [x] https://github.com/atom/encoding-selector/issues/23
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/264
- [x] https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/270
- [x] https://github.com/atom/notifications/issues/42
- [x] https://github.com/atom/notifications/issues/79
- [x] https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/536
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/151
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/183 (affecting 535 people)
# Text Editor

_These seem to originate from either the model or view for the text editor._
## Core
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5311
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5905
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5997
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6117
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6118
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6119
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6831
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6973
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7063
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7070
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7198
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7248
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7465
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7582
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7720
## Packages
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/issues/119
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/issues/136
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/issues/144
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/343
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/git-diff/issues/57
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/122
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/whitespace/issues/71
# Text Buffer

_These appear to originate from errors within the text-buffer repository._
## Core
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6753
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7352
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7398
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7409
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7672 (affecting 140 people)
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7678
## Packages
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom-dark-syntax/issues/11
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/issues/142
- [x] https://github.com/atom/go-to-line/issues/22 (affecting 140 people)
- [x] https://github.com/atom/go-to-line/issues/23
# Process/Task

_These appear to be from spawning processes or tasks_
## Core
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4775
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7459 (affecting 600 people)
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7594
## Packages
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/495
# 3rd party packages

_These appear to be from third-party packages and not fixable from within Atom. These might be closeable with just a comment._
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7721
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/status-bar/issues/86
# Invalid cases

_These appear to be errors from corrupted models and other conditions that should never happen._
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6235
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/snippets/issues/103
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/whitespace/issues/79
# Require errors

_These appear to be errors from calling require._
## Core
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6276
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7591
## Packages
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/192
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/399
# File I/O

_These appear to be errors from reading or writing files._
## Core
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2539
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4467
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5307
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5640
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5999
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6046
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6140
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6348
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6799
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6838
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7133
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7321
- [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7651
## Packages
- [x] https://github.com/atom/autosave/issues/29
- [x] https://github.com/atom/autosave/issues/33
- [x] https://github.com/atom/autosave/issues/36
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/523
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/412
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/416
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/419
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/425
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/436
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/448
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/465
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/470
- [x] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/409
# No Idea

_These are real head scratchers. Any insight appreciated._
## Core
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4792
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6089
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6102
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6632

## Packages
- [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-atom-api/issues/6
- [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-atom-api/issues/7
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/command-palette/issues/47
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/236
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/symbols-view/issues/110
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/108
- [ ] https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/408

data.title: Add support for disabling context menu items
data.body:
I don't see a way in the contextMenu.add API to dynamically disable/re-enable a menu item: https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.0.0/ContextMenuManager#instance-add. 

Can we get a way to disable (shown but not selectable) and enable context menu items? Something like .shouldEnable(event) - takes a function with event?

data.title: Feature Request: Pressing `esc` on multiple cursors returns you to original cursor location.
data.body:
After selecting multiple words by pressing `cmd-d` multiple times, then pressing `esc` key to go back to a single cursor, it seems to place the single cursor at the position of the last cursor that was added.  I would like it to place the single cursor at the original selection.

Explanation:
I got used to Sublime positioning the single cursor at the original cursor location.  At first, I thought it was an arbitrary decision and that I would adjust to atom's way of doing it.  Now I've decided that it's not entirely subjective.  In many cases, my original cursor was intentionally placed at the original position, and that's where I would like it to return to.  For example, maybe I was editing something in-line and thought that this particular word (variable name) I was editing should be edited in a few places at the same time.  After doing this, I would like to return to my original train of thought - editing that line that I was on before creating multiple selections.  I would also think that in any cases where I didn't intentionally place my cursor on a particular instance, the decision is arbitrary whether it takes me to the original or final cursor upon pressing `esc`, so this might be a safe change to make for all use cases.  At least an option for altering this behavior would be much-appreciated.

data.title: The async repositoryForDirectory calls directory.getRealPathSync()
data.body:
There should be an async `getRealPath()` in https://github.com/atom/node-pathwatcher/blob/master/src/directory.coffee and that be called here instead.

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/645139f452a7a261a77c6413ec4c1fe9cfee6cf5/src/project.coffee#L144

This doesn't work for the remote development use case, because you can't get the real path of a directory synchronously (could be a symlink).

/cc @maxbrunsfeld @bolinfest

data.title: Code completion does not work with dollar sign $ in var (1.0.0)
data.body:
None of these will work with code completion

```
var foo$
var $foo
var foo$foo
```

data.title: Remove leftover update statements
data.body:
This PR gets rid of a couple of `update` statements in `TextEditorPresenter` that were getting executed when some event was triggered. They are unnecessary because they’ll get executed anyway as soon as `getState` is called.

Although this is pretty straightforward, another pair of :eyes: is most welcome. Thanks! :bow: 

/cc: @nathansobo @atom/feedback

data.title: window:show-next-item, window:show-previous-item
data.body: Now we can move with shortcuts to next/preview tab only inside focused pane with `pane:show-previous-item, pane:show-next-item`. It will be useful if we have global window shortcuts for moving to next/preview tab through all panes. Something like `window:show-next-item, window:show-previous-item`. This shortcuts must work on window level no matter where focus is. (for example if focus on tree-view)

data.title: rename in file tree,  old-file remains
data.body:
hi, I`m new.

when I rename file in file tree with GUI while this file  opened in tabs, the tab of this file remain opened, and the name did not changed.
Is this designed to be so or an bug?

And, delete file in file tree and click "Move to trash" did not work for me.
PS.  I install atom on centos 7 using atom.rpm with lastest version.

data.title: unresponsive on loading big files
data.body:
copy-pasting the content of the minified css below files make atom unresponsive for ~20secs. atom helper load goes up to 100%

reporter-ohne-grenzen.de/fileadmin/templates/assets/dist/style.min.css

data.title: Confusing project path on windows bar
data.body:
Hey,
When more than one projects are opened on the editor, if we edit a file on the project added after the first one, the path shown just after the name of the opened file in the windows title bar is always the path of the first opened project.
This can cause confusion for the user if the same file name is present in multiple projects.

Step to reproduce:
- Add projectA, and projectB.
- Open a file on projectB.
- Look at the windows title bar :
  `file - /home/statelesscat/projetAPath - Atom`

data.title: Improve Command-W behavior on OS X
data.body:
OS X 10.10.4
Atom 1.0

When you no longer have open tabs, pressing Command-W should close the front window and focus the next unminimized window, if there are any.

This is how Sublime Text 3 behaves. Google Chrome also behaves similarly, except that they do it when you have a single open tab. Pressing Command-W when you have a single open tab will close the window and shift focus to the next open window unless it's minimized.

Originally posted in #7428.

data.title: .atom-text-editor class not working
data.body:
I would like to use F1 to toggle the tree.

I am currently using `.editor` which is deprecated in favour of `.atom-text-editor`. However the new class doesn't seem to work.

keymap.cson

```
'.editor':
  'f1': 'tree-view:toggle'

'.atom-workspace':
  'f1': 'tree-view:toggle'
```

data.title: Find/replace not working with PHP vars (whole word)

Hi!

I use Atom 1.0 on Windows 7 x64.

Whole word option is enabled.
If I try to replace some variables in PHP with `$`, replace doesn't work. Works only without `$`. 
Also find don't working with `$`.

data.title: Limit to Snippet Variables?
data.body: Is there a limit to how many variables can be in a single snippet, and if so, what is that limit? I tried to create a boilerplate snippet that had 9 variables, and it only worked for the first 6 of them. But I'm not sure if that was simply due to a mistype or not...

data.title: Run Package Specs In Headless Mode
data.body:
I am writing a package (https://atom.io/packages/tester) that will be to testers what linter is to linters and ac+ is to autocomplete engines.

I would like to bundle a built-in tester that:
- Runs package specs for the currently active project
- Collects the results
- Displays the test results to the user, in a panel
- Highlights failed specs in-line, like linter does with lint errors

In order to do this, I need to figure out how to run atom's spec runner heedlessly, without showing the spec runner.
- The meat of the current `run-package-specs` behavior: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/259d42d2852fea9700fbcf85cb96a0aa9ebf9865/src/browser/atom-application.coffee#L499-L511
- `apm` runs things by spawning `atom` itself: https://github.com/atom/apm/blob/f18c91d2c0f41cf5d063e5127b322a51478cd50e/src/test.coffee#L39-L65
- `atom-application` does stuff with the `test` flag: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/259d42d2852fea9700fbcf85cb96a0aa9ebf9865/src/browser/atom-application.coffee#L90-L91, which calls back into https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/259d42d2852fea9700fbcf85cb96a0aa9ebf9865/src/browser/atom-application.coffee#L499-L511

So, @maxbrunsfeld, @nathansobo, @mnquintana et al. Is this doable? And to really stretch my luck, what are the chances of getting structured spec output (i.e. `json`?) instead of text output as the current formatter provides?

data.title: After Save-As, hover over tab shows old filename
data.body:
I had a file open. Used Save-As to save with a different name.
Then put to mouse over the title of the buffer at the top of the window and the blue pop-out was still showing the name of the original file. (The filename written on the title is correct.)
Seen in Atom 1.0.0 using OSX.

data.title: Ignore dot files/folders for packages
data.body: See this issue for more details, https://github.com/TypeStrong/atom-typescript/issues/365

data.title: Check if error message exists before using it in Pane.handleSaveError
data.body:
This should fix https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7714, though I'm not really sure when an error won't have a message defined (other than manually setting it to undefined, which a package could do I guess?). 

cc @kevinsawicki for :thought_balloon: :eyes:

data.title: Improve Atom Flight Manual: 3.3 Package: Word Count
data.body:
Someone generate package as `wordcount`, his or her package will be shown as a deprecated package.

Because many names look like `lib/wordcount.coffee` and `keymaps/wordcount.cson`, many os use can name their packages `wordcount` and will get deprecated messages.
